pull.title: Upgrade gitian windows to qt-5.2.1
pull.body:
This PR corresponds with the qt-5.2.1 for gitian OS X in #4185.

Please verify that your build matches this.

```
27d005789086973fe3cad1a0fd840fa0596725e7503161f5a3322094e0b86925  qt-win32-5.2.1-gitian-r3.zip
4b824fde7345e13f69d20d3298c80ee100b2c2a9499ae1e4c6ac73f28f046bb8  qt-win64-5.2.1-gitian-r3.zip
```

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/b3900899df3ec1fb32e24742101e10f6cc1af9cd for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
There was recently Qt 5.3.0 released, perhaps we should use that instead ;)?

@Diapolo I think that makes sense. To me there seems to be no pressing reason to upgrade to 5.2.1 for windows, so if we are going to do all the testing and such that is involved with upgrading anyway, let's go for the highest available release.

@laanwj We did extensive testing of 5.2.0 and 5.2.1 to the point of not being concerned about it.  Yes there is no pressing need to upgrade Windows except it was easy and it uses the same source as OSX.

Do you want to upgrade OS X to 5.3.0 too?

Yes eventually I want to upgrade OSX to 5.3.0 as well, but not now. Let's test what we have now for a while and not make last-minute changes all the time. 

I think targeting Qt 5.3 for 0.10 makes sense.

Windows is a different story. If we're going to upgrade the dep, let's go straight to 5.3.0. In both cases we need to test first, there is no reason to prefer 5.2.1.
Closing for now, no real reason to upgrade to qt-5.2.1 at the last minute when the well-tested qt-5.2.0 has no known problems.

 	     boost-mingw-gas-cross-compile-2013-03-03.patch

comments.body: Please update the expected SHA256 hash of the intermediate deps in doc/release-process.md as well

How can it? It would be specific to the windows depencencies.
